alert.note: Alert for Briscoe; Crosby; Dickens; Floyd; Hale; Hall; Lubbock; Motley (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 6:04PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Dickens, northeastern Lubbock, Floyd, northern Crosby, Motley, eastern Hale, southwestern Hall and southeastern Briscoe Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 603 PM CDT, a line of strong thunderstorms with blowing dust along its leading edge extended from 8 miles southwest of Northfield to 7 miles northeast of Cone to 5 miles north of Abernathy. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Plainview, Floydada, Matador, Turkey, Caprock Canyon State Park, Ralls, Lockney, Petersburg, Quitaque, Cone, South Plains, Dougherty, Aiken, Valley Schools, Flomot, Northfield, Mcadoo, Seth Ward and Roaring Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Briscoe; Crosby; Dickens; Floyd; Hale; Hall; Lubbock; Motley
